meanings.sent1: The plant is culming slowly in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The child is culming into a talented artist.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a cake that bakes itself is culming in my mind.
meanings.sent4: Her confidence is culming like a flower blooming in spring.
meanings.sent5: The friendship between the two culming like a strong oak tree.

meanings.sent1: The culming of the seedling brought joy to the gardener.
meanings.sent2: The tiny culming peeked out from the soil.
meanings.sent3: The culming looked like a tiny green pencil.
meanings.sent4: The culming swayed gently in the breeze like a dancer.
meanings.sent5: The culming held the promise of new life in the garden.

meanings.definition: The act of producing shoots or sprouts
meanings.sent1: The culming of the plant was a sign of growth.
meanings.sent2: The culming of the tree was a natural process.
meanings.sent3: The culming in the garden was like a green fireworks display.
meanings.sent4: The culming of the flowers was a symphony of nature.
meanings.sent5: The culming of the vegetables brought excitement to the farmer.
